name: Butternut Squash Curry with Chickpeas
description: Every bite of this Butternut Squash Curry with Chickpeas is loaded with roasted butternut squash, chickpeas, and a flavorful and creamy base. Enjoy it as a comforting dinner or weekly meal prep during fall!
recipeIngredient: 4 cups chopped butternut squash (1 small or 1/2 large)
15 ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce (or tamari for gluten free)

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and grease a large baking sheet with olive oil (or line with parchment paper).
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and grease a large baking sheet with olive oil (or line with parchment paper).

itemListElement.text: Add the chopped butternut squash, drizzle with a few tablespoons of olive oil, sprinkle with a little salt and pepper, and bake for 30-45 minutes, until golden and browned in spots.
itemListElement.name: Add the chopped butternut squash, drizzle with a few tablespoons of olive oil, sprinkle with a little salt and pepper, and bake for 30-45 minutes, until golden and browned in spots.

recipeInstructions.name: While the squash roasts, prepare the curry

itemListElement.text: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the diced onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until translucent.
itemListElement.name: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the diced onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until translucent.

itemListElement.text: Now add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook, stirring frequently for about 2 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Now add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook, stirring frequently for about 2 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Stir in the red curry paste and turmeric. Pour in the coconut milk, broth and chickpeas and stir to combine.
itemListElement.name: Stir in the red curry paste and turmeric. Pour in the coconut milk, broth and chickpeas and stir to combine.

itemListElement.text: Bring to a boil, then lower heat so the mixture is simmering but not boiling hard. Cover and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the squash has finished baking.
itemListElement.name: Bring to a boil, then lower heat so the mixture is simmering but not boiling hard. Cover and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the squash has finished baking.

itemListElement.text: Stir in the soy sauce, sugar, lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Now stir in the roasted butternut squash and baby spinach. Let the spinach wilt for a minute or two, then remove from heat.
itemListElement.name: Stir in the soy sauce, sugar, lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Now stir in the roasted butternut squash and baby spinach. Let the spinach wilt for a minute or two, then remove from heat.

itemListElement.text: Serve with cooked rice, chopped cilantro or basil, lime wedges, chopped nuts and hot sauce. Enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Serve with cooked rice, chopped cilantro or basil, lime wedges, chopped nuts and hot sauce. Enjoy!
